alert.note: Alert for Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 04 at 9:37PM EDT until September 08 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Little Pee Dee River At Galivants Ferry affecting Horry and Marion Counties. Waccamaw River At Conway affecting Horry County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Lumber River 1 SE Nichols affecting Horry, Marion and Dillon Counties. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Little Pee Dee River...including Galivants Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Waccamaw River...including Aiw At old Hwy 544 At Socastee, Conway, Above Conway, Freeland, Longs...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Northeast Cape Fear River near Burgaw. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Floodwaters cause roads to become impassable in the River Bend, River Birch and Alligator Lake subdivisions off Highway 53. These areas become isolated due to the floodwaters and some evacuations may be needed. In the Holly Shelter Estates subdivision, half of the area has water on the roads due to floodwaters. Approximately 12 homes on Old Maple Hill Road off Shaw Highway become isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Friday morning and continue falling to 8.3 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by this evening.
